source_sentence: 佛說琉璃王經
translation: Foshuo lapis lazuli king jing

source_sentence: 西晉月氏國三藏竺法護譯
translation: Translated by Zhu Fahou, a translator of the Tripiṭaka of the Western Jin state of Yuezhi

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛遊迦維羅衛釋氏精舍，尼拘類樹下，與五百比丘、侍者阿難、金剛力士樓由俱。
translation: Thus I have heard. At one time the Buddha was staying at the monastery belonging to the Śākya clan in Kapilavastu, accompanied by five hundred bhikṣus (monks), his attendant Ānanda and the Vajrapāṇi-śrāmaṇer Rājagṛha, together with a company of five hundred monks:

source_sentence: 於城中有舍夷貴姓五百長者，共為世尊造立講堂，自相興誓：「講堂成已，
translation: In the city, there were five hundred wealthy elders of Śāriputra’s noble families who built a lecture hall together for the World-honored One. They all made this vow:

source_sentence: 當請正覺於上設供，沙門、梵志、長者居士、群黎人民，不得先佛妄昇此堂；
translation: You should invite the true enlightened one to set up an offering in the assembly hall. The renunciants, brahmins, wealthy householders, and members of the common people will not be allowed to ascend into this hall by mistake before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 若違要者，罪在不測。」
translation: If someone disobeys the essentials, their sin is unfathomable.

source_sentence: 舍衛國王，時有太子名維樓黎——產育之初，與琉璃寶俱，因以為號——領衛士定省外氏，
translation: At that time the king of Sāvatthī had a prince named Virūḍhaka-who was born at the beginning of his mother’s life, together with a lapis lazuli treasure; he therefore called himself Virūḍhaka.

source_sentence: 方來入城，見視講堂，高廣嚴淨，都雅殊妙，世所希有，則於其上，頓止息涼。
translation: He came to the city and saw that the assembly hall was lofty and spacious, grand and beautifully decorated, rare in the world. Suddenly it became calm and cool.

source_sentence: 監講堂者，往白諸貴姓言：「舍衛太子來止講堂。」
translation: The superintendent of the lecture hall went to the noble family members and said, Prince Sāriputta has come to stay in the lecture hall.

source_sentence: 貴姓聞之，興怒罵曰：「吾等家產。
translation: When the noble family heard this, they became angry and scolded him, saying, “We have all our property.

source_sentence: 有何異德，敢登此堂？
translation: What extraordinary virtuous person would dare to ascend to this hall?

source_sentence: 本造斯殿，乃為佛舉，當具上饌，延屈世尊至真聖眾，供養畢訖，然後吾等乃宜自處；
translation: Formerly this hall was built for the Buddha’s sake. It will be decorated with delicious food and served to the World-honored One, who is truly a holy being. After having completed his offerings, we should go our own place.

source_sentence: 而微者前尊，置體于此。」
translation: The inferior one, the former honored one, puts his body here.

source_sentence: 尋遣使者面罵辱之，催逐發遣，令不久滯，所蹈之地，剗去足跡，所履寶階，
translation: The envoy was soon driven away, disgraced in the form of a footstool on the ground where he had walked and the precious steps he had climbed.

source_sentence: 輒更貿易。
translation: They'll then trade again.

source_sentence: 時，琉璃太子聞其罵音，姿色變動，心懷毒恚，勅太史曰：「深憶記之，
translation: When the prince of Lapis lazuli heard the sound of his scolding, his countenance changed and his heart trembled in fear. The crown prince said to the courtier, “I deeply recall your words:

source_sentence: 須吾為王，當誅此類。」
translation: If you need me to be king, I will punish this kind of person.

source_sentence: 太史阿薩陀(晉名無信)能觀天文、占究災怪，令書此狀內于帶中，俠惡識非，
translation: The court historian Asita (known as Wuxin in the Jin dynasty) was able to observe astronomy and divine calamities and wonders, so he ordered him to write this image inside the belt.

source_sentence: 嚴退還歸，不復前至朝覲外家。
translation: Yan withdrew and returned home. He went no longer to the imperial court to see the non-Buddhist monks.

source_sentence: 太子父王名波斯匿，與后末利，駕乘導從，詣祇樹園。
translation: The prince’s father, the king Prasenajit by name, accompanied the queen and the duchess Māra in their carriages to the Jetavana Garden.

source_sentence: 下車却蓋，免冠解劍，屏拂脫屣，除四種兵。
translation: He dismounted from his chariot and rejected the canopy, relieved himself of his crown and swords, and withdrew to take up his posture in silence. All but the four kinds of troops were absent.

source_sentence: 步涉小徑，與末利俱，五體投地，稽首為禮，却坐一面。
translation: He walked along a small path accompanied by Malli, prostrated himself on the ground with his five bodies, paid homage with his head in respect, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 琉璃太子時歸還宮，無所瞻覩，問左右曰：「父王、太后今為所？」
translation: When the prince of Lapis lazuli returned to the palace, he had nothing to look at and asked his attendants, Where are your father and queen now?

source_sentence: 湊曰：「造佛。」
translation: They gathered together and said, create buddhas.

source_sentence: 太子聞問，欣率所領，不復解嚴，遂至精舍，曰：「宜知是時。」
translation: When the prince heard the question, he was delighted to take it and didn't understand the adornment again, so he went to the monastery and said, You should know this is the right time.

source_sentence: 於是，太子逼害翼從、王之近臣，五百餘人，一時夷滅，却王冠幘蓋劍拂履服乘諸飾，
translation: Thereupon, the prince was harmed by his flanks and all the king’s ministers who were close to him. More than five hundred of them were killed simultaneously. Their robes, crowns, parasols, canopies, swords, sandals, cloths, footwear, and other ornaments were taken away from their royal garments.

source_sentence: 外無白者。
translation: There's no white outsider.

source_sentence: 於時，世尊為王及后說世無常、愛欲合、會別離法句，王立不退轉，后得覩道迹。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān explained to the king and his queen that the world is impermanent, united by craving and desire, separated by assembly and separation from the teachings, established by the king without retreating, and the queen attained the path of sexual misconduct.

source_sentence: 佛說經已，王稽首退，不見侍輔，而僵尸狼籍，唯王衣冠二人得免，逃入樹間，
translation: After the Buddha had discoursed on the sutra, the king bowed his head and withdrew without seeing any attendants or assistants. The crippled corpse was born in a wolf’s womb; only the two men wearing royal robes and crowns escaped by fleeing into a tree.

source_sentence: 還與王遇。
translation: He returned to meet the king.

source_sentence: 王問之曰：「群僚所在？」
translation: The king asked him, Where are the officials?

source_sentence: 二人答曰：「太子率勒所統，脇將還宮。」
translation: The two men answered, The prince's ruler is led by Śāriputra, and he's about to return to the palace.

source_sentence: 王謂末利：「子造不順，謀逆如斯。
translation: The king said to Mālya, “Your unruly scheme is like this.

source_sentence: 素知此，吾當避，以國付，之精舍。」
translation: Knowing this, I'll avoid it and give it to the monastery as my country.

source_sentence: 左有族姓，愍王及后體柔狀樂不堪步，濟以車乘，弊陋難處，遂昇進邁至于城門。
translation: On the left side, there was a clansman of which the king and queen were unable to walk because their bodies were so gentle and pliant that they could not walk. They rode in chariots to rescue them from the rough and unstable place and proceeded gradually until they reached the city gates.

source_sentence: 先時，太子列五百人置門鎮衛，勅門監曰：「若父王來，勿聽使入。」
translation: Earlier, the prince was lined up with five hundred people to guard the gate and commanded the gatekeeper to tell them, If your father comes, don't allow him to enter.

source_sentence: 王曰：「若不得入，吾將焉如？」
translation: The king said, If you can't enter, how will I do it?

source_sentence: 曰：「詔大王當令出境。」
translation: He said, I'll order the great king to allow him to leave the boundary.

source_sentence: 「誠哉世尊教，　　所演審而諦，
translation: “Splendid is the teaching of the World-honored One, Who teaches with discernment and truth.

source_sentence: 興衰與貴賤，　　一切無常住。
translation: The rise and fall, and the noble and the humble, All are impermanent and abiding.

source_sentence: 寧守戒念道，　　不貪厚俸祿，
translation: They would rather observe the precepts and be mindful of the path, Not covetous of generous salaries.

source_sentence: 僥聞講法會，　　不願億國土。
translation: I've heard the Dharma assembly with such good fortune that I won't wish for a billion lands.

source_sentence: 王據國恣情，　　饕穢遑所欲，
translation: The king relies on his country's arbitrariness, indulging in debauchery and wanting what he wants.

source_sentence: 聞法蒙解脫，　　塵垢用消除。」
translation: He hears the teaching and is liberated, and his dust and dirt are removed.

source_sentence: 時，王波斯匿涕泣哽噎，以偈歎曰：爾時，觀者無數千人，聞王歎音，
translation: Then King Prasenajit, weeping and sobbing in tears, said in verse, Countless thousands of people saw the king’s exclamation.

source_sentence: 八百人發大道意，皆立不退，轉憂色不悅。
translation: Eight hundred people aroused the aspiration for enlightenment, all established themselves without retreating, and became sad and unhappy.

source_sentence: 王后末利白王曰：「幸勿愁憒，可共俱逝還我父國。」
translation: The queen of the king's empress, Māra, said to the king, Please don't grieve; let's go together and return to our father's country.

source_sentence: 即便進發，七日七夜，到迦維羅衛兜薩聚，值冥門閉，亦不得入。
translation: Soon after seven days and nights he proceeded on his way to Kapilavastu, where he met with the door shut in the darkness and was unable to enter.

source_sentence: 各共飢渴，無所向仰，求乞無地，止於水傍人洗菜處，得迸蘿蔔食之，
translation: They were all hungry and thirsty, with no one to look up to. There was no place for them to beg. They stopped at a place near the water where they had washed their vegetables so that they could eat from the bursting grapes.

source_sentence: 臚脹腹痛而薨。
translation: He was swollen and pained in the abdomen and died.

source_sentence: 王后悲慟，舉聲大哭，守聚者問曰：「何人乎？」
translation: The queen was overcome with grief and cried out in tears, and the guards asked, Who is it?

source_sentence: 曰：「吾王后也。」
translation: He said, I'm the king's queen.

source_sentence: 又問：「王為在何乎？」
translation: Again, he asked, Where is the king?

source_sentence: 后曰：「痛哉！
translation: The queen said, How painful!

source_sentence: 王薨水側。」
translation: The king died beside the water.

source_sentence: 聚守門者即馳白舍夷諸貴姓，貴姓聞凶，奔波驚愕，尋皆來，出賵贈殯棺，
translation: The guards at the gate of the monastery rushed to report this to the noble families of Śāyin. When they heard the news of the evil, all the villagers were startled and fled in fear. They came out to offer their coffins for burial mounds.

source_sentence: 闍維如法，咸皆號悼，莫不摧感。
translation: The ācārya and all the other monks followed the Dharma. They all wailed in mourning, and none of them did not grieve.

source_sentence: 「有子有財思惟波波，　　我自非我何有子財，
translation: “If someone has children and property, contemplate Upagupta: If I am self or not self, how can I have children and property?

source_sentence: 愚癡自怙豪尊有終，　　太子用國殪入地獄。」
translation: Foolishly, the prince uses his kingdom to go to hell with a crown prince who's arrogant and has an end.

source_sentence: 爾時，貴族釋摩男者，瞿夷之父也，與諸豪右，以偈歎曰：釋氏貴姓二百五十，
translation: At that time, the noble son of Śākyamuni, the father of Gopīyān, joined the members of the royal community and praised him in verse:

source_sentence: 深惟無常，得不退轉。
translation: He deeply contemplates impermanence and attains nonretrogression.

source_sentence: 五百女人，未出家者，得不起法忍。
translation: Five hundred women who hadn't renounced home attained the tolerance of not rising above the Dharma.

source_sentence: 於是，琉璃太子聞父王薨，即在殿稱制為王。
translation: Then, when the prince of Lapis lazuli heard that his father, the king, had died, he was in the palace and called it the king.

source_sentence: 異道太史出帶中書，證案本狀記惡之忌。
translation: The non-Buddhist historian Taishou produced a book in the belt, which proves that the original form of the scriptures and records are bad taboos.

source_sentence: 聞之大怒，心意憤踊，召四種兵，伐迦維羅衛。
translation: Hearing this, the king was greatly angered and angry. He summoned four divisions of his army to attack Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 佛知其意，從精舍出，止于路要，坐於荄枯樹下。
translation: Knowing his intention, the Buddha came out of the monastery and stopped at the crossroads to sit under a withered tree.

source_sentence: 斯須之頃，太子軍至。
translation: When it was necessary, the prince’s army arrived.

source_sentence: 時，琉璃王遙見世尊，即便下象車，稽首于地，長跪問佛：「唯，天中天！
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān from a distance, the king of lapis lazuli descended from his elephant chariot and bowed his head at the ground. Kneeling upright, he asked the Buddha:

source_sentence: 有菩提附差、尼拘類、畢鉢、優曇鉢、薩羅、怛羅、揵尼赦羅，有此七樹，
translation: There are these seven kinds of trees: the enlightenment bodhi tree, the fig tree, the nyagrodha tree, the pippala tree, the udumbara tree, the sarvatra tree, the kiṃnara tree, and the upāsaka tree.

source_sentence: 其蔭高大，有德茂盛，何因棄捨，處枯槁多刺樹耶？」
translation: Its shade is high and lofty, and its virtue flourishes; why did you abandon it and place it in a withered tree with many thorns?

source_sentence: 佛告琉璃王：「雖有七樹，樹蔭茂盛，盛豈有常？
translation: The Buddha told the king of the lapis lazuli, Even though there are seven trees, how could their shade and abundance be constant?

source_sentence: 吾坐刺樹，以為安隱，用哀愍傷親屬故也。」
translation: I sat cross-legged at the tree in order to make myself comfortable, and it's because I grieved for my relatives.

source_sentence: 王心念言：「先古所載，藏室祕讖，用兵征旅遇沙門者，轉迴軍還，況今值佛，
translation: The king thought to himself, “Once long ago the holy scriptures were preserved in secret in the treasury chambers of the monastery. When an army confronted a śramaṇa he turned his troops around and returned home. How much more so when he encountered the Buddha!

source_sentence: 焉得進乎？」
translation: How could they advance?

source_sentence: 稽首佛足，即便反旅。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet and departed.

source_sentence: 還于舍衛來日未久，侍者阿難、力士樓由，翼從世尊還尼拘類園，令阿難敷座，
translation: Soon after returning to Sāvatthī, the World-honored One’s attendant Ānanda and the strong man Lohitya flew away from the World-honored One and returned to the pleasure grove at Nirgrantha Monastery.

source_sentence: 宣告四輩，皆令集會。
translation: He proclaimed the four groups of people and ordered them all to assemble.

source_sentence: 時佛尊顏姿容無燿，項無光明，衣服變色。
translation: Venerable Buddha then had a face that was without shining, a neck that didn't shine, and his clothes changed color.

source_sentence: 阿難察坐已定，則整衣法服，右膝投地，叉手白言：「侍尊積年，未覩三變。」
translation: After he had settled his seat, Ānanda adjusted his robe and Dharma robe, knelt with his right knee to the ground, saluted him with his palms together, and said, For many years, the honored attendant hasn't changed three times.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「却數七日，迦維羅衛釋氏貴姓，皆當傷斃。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, “Seven days from now the noble family of Kapilavastu will all be injured and die.

source_sentence: 現斯變者，為中家持服故也。」
translation: It's because this transformation is manifested for the sake of maintaining the middle family's clothing.

source_sentence: 大目揵連前白世尊：「是何足言？
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to the Bhagavān, What's the sufficient thing to say?

source_sentence: 我之神力，正覺所究，能以右掌，舉舍夷國，跳置空中，上不至天，下不至地，
translation: Because of my supernatural powers, which are sought by the Perfectly Awakened One. With my right palm, I can lift up the country of Sāvatthī and hover in midair without touching heaven or earth.

source_sentence: 琉璃王殺焉能得乎？」
translation: How could it be possible to kill the king of lapis lazuli?

source_sentence: 佛告目連：「知汝威德，過足如斯，宿命之罪，誰當代受？」
translation: The Buddha told Maudgalyāyana, Knowing that your authority and virtue are so great as to be sufficient, who will suffer the sins of past lives at the same time?

source_sentence: 又曰：「能以鐵文籠，疏遮此國，上又以鉢覆，使無形候，擲置他方異土；
translation: He also said, “You can cover this country with an iron cage and throw it into a different land. Cover it with your bowl so that it has no shape or color.

source_sentence: 又以四披須彌山，南內著于山，然後合之，各得所安；
translation: Again, the enlightening beings take Mount Sumeru in four pairs and place it on the southern side of the mountain; then they join together to find their abode.

source_sentence: 又大海水，深廣之量，三百三十六萬里，我以此國，浮置中央，令諸人民無往來想；
translation: Again, the great water of the great ocean is three hundred and thirty-six million li in depth and breadth. I have placed this country at the center of the great sea so that the people will not think of it as coming or going.

source_sentence: 又一以此國，倚須彌山頂，復能倒覆，令無毀害；
translation: In this land one can rest on the top of a polar mountain and overturn it so that no harm will be done.

source_sentence: 又下沒之金剛地際，又打擲于琉璃王眾四種之兵，置大鐵圍山表，使兩怨敵不相討伐。」
translation: Again, he descends to the limit of the adamantine ground and tosses the four kinds of troops of the lapis lazuli king's army on the edge of a great ring of iron mountain so that the two enemies won't attack each other.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, Good!

source_sentence: 世尊信汝，此十威力，能辦此舉。
translation: The World-honored One believes that these ten mighty powers enable you to accomplish this feat.

source_sentence: 舍夷貴戚，宿世殃罪，孰堪畢償而代受者？」
translation: Śāriputra's noble relative is guilty of the sins of past lives, so who will be able to pay them back and accept them in their place?

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「寧有譎詭，祐護此國，令安隱乎？」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, How could there be such a deceitful person who protects this country and makes it peaceful?

source_sentence: 佛言：「若舍夷人能同心，不與外讎有往來緣，國可全也。」
translation: The Buddha said, If the people of Śākyamuni can be with one mind and don't have any past or future connections with external disputes, the country can be complete.

source_sentence: 太史三諫：「王宜用時進討舍夷。」
translation: The Taishang three times remonstrated, saying, It's advisable for the king to use his time to attack Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 王聞赫怒，興軍勒眾。
translation: When the king heard this he became furious and raised an army to quell the crowd.

source_sentence: 世尊知之，還坐枯樹。
translation: Knowing this, the World-honored One returned to his seat under a withered tree.

source_sentence: 如是至三，王亦三還。
translation: Thus, up to the third, the king also returned three times.

source_sentence: 第四征時，佛不遂屬，精銳四品之兵，到舍夷國界。
translation: At the time of the fourth expedition, when the Buddha was unable to follow him, he sent his four-pronged army of sharp men to the frontier of Sāvatthī.

source_sentence: 釋氏豪姓，又亦多集，眾出而禦之。
translation: The powerful members of the Śākya clan also gathered together in great numbers to defend the castle.

source_sentence: 族黨驍勇，強盛善射，射四十里者、射二十里者、十里者、七里者任其本德，
translation: His clans and tribesmen were valiant and strong in good shooting. Those who shot at distances of forty li, twenty li, ten li, or seven li did so according to their original talents.

source_sentence: 御飛破初，箭不虛發，能析一髮，以為七分，去有里數射盡中之，尋聲應弦，
translation: At the beginning of the flight, the arrow does not go off in an unreal way. It can disintegrate into a single piece and be counted as seven parts [of the arrow' s body].

source_sentence: 曾無遺漏。
translation: It's never been left untouched.

source_sentence: 於是交戰，射琉璃王軍，穿幡折幢，裂蓋摧杠；
translation: Then the two armies engaged in battle and shot at the king’s army of lapis lazuli. They passed through banners, broke down banners, split canopies, and shattered banners.

source_sentence: 截轅韅攝，決鎧帶韅；
translation: He cut off the upper part of his carriage and placed it in a saddle, carrying an armor worn by him.

source_sentence: 絕弓弩弦，不害象馬牛畜之命；
translation: They cut off the strings of their bow and crossbow and did not harm the lives of elephants, horses, cattle, or animals.

source_sentence: 射珥臂指環釧瓔珞，而不中肌；
translation: He wore a necklace of archer’s arms, fingernails, rings, and ornaments, but he did not wear the middle skin.

source_sentence: 翦除鬚髮左右眉鬚髮毛睫，亦不害體。
translation: He removes the hair on his left and right eyebrows, hair, hair, and eyelashes, and doesn't harm his body.

source_sentence: 琉璃怖駭，問臣下曰：「敵去此幾何？
translation: Fearful, the lapis lazuli asked his ministers, How far away is the enemy from here?

source_sentence: 而箭所至傷毀若茲。」
translation: Where the arrow reaches, it's like this.

source_sentence: 答曰：「或四十里、二十里、十里，近者七里。」
translation: He answered, It might be forty miles, twenty miles, or ten miles, and the nearest is seven miles.

source_sentence: 王聞加悸，不能自寧，將破敵軍，即悸退還。
translation: When the king heard this, he trembled and could not control himself. He was about to defeat the enemy army and withdrew in fear.

source_sentence: 太史諫曰：「大王莫懼！
translation: The crown prince remonstrated, saying, Don't be afraid, great king!

source_sentence: 慎無敗却。
translation: He's careful not to lose it.

source_sentence: 舍夷人民，皆奉佛戒，為清信士，慈仁不殺，以箭恐人，無傷害意，寧自喪身，
translation: The people of Sāvatthī all obeyed the Buddha’s precepts. They were pure believers and, out of compassion and kindness, they did not kill. They threatened others with an arrow without intention of inflicting harm but preferred to kill themselves.

source_sentence: 不夭生命。
translation: They won't die.

source_sentence: 且更整陣，併心撲討，將牢持重，尅捷不久。」
translation: I'll be able to assemble my troops and combine my efforts to suppress the enemy, holding the heavy burden in my chest; it won't be long before I can attack.

source_sentence: 諸臣啟曰：「察敵軍射，陷遠無形，非力所距，懼被摧折，永令臣等為糜戮之，
translation: The ministers said, “The enemy’s army is far-reaching and formless. It cannot be separated from us by force. We are afraid that it will be vanquished and annihilated.

source_sentence: 慮箭不可當，置時據安，小史之謀，不足專從，各各心動，志在迸徂。」
translation: He thought that the arrow couldn't be appropriate, so he placed it in a peaceful place at the time and didn't concentrate on the lesser history of his plot; each one moved his mind with the intention to plunder it.

source_sentence: 王大奮怒，催勅進戰。
translation: The king became furious and ordered the army to enter battle.

source_sentence: 舍夷外眾，奔走保城，閉門自固，列陣圍繞。
translation: The outsider Śāriputra fled to preserve the city walls, locking the gates and fortifying themselves. They were all surrounded by rows of soldiers.

source_sentence: 至于七日，示悟去就，招懷誘納，唱令內寇，宜時歸命，若不出降，殄滅爾類。
translation: On the seventh day, he showed his enlightenment and departed. He invited some of his retainers to take advantage of him and ordered them to invade the empire. It was better for him to return home at the right time; but if he did not do so, it would be a good idea to annihilate those who came before him.

source_sentence: 釋氏共議，當堅城守禦當閉門稽顙，當密潛奔竄，躊躇狼狽，則各賦籌，
translation: The members of the Śākya clan agreed in principle that they should secure the city walls, keep the gates shut to prevent anyone from attacking it. They secretly ran away and fled in fear and were unable to do so. Thus each member of the clan offered a cheque [to the king].

source_sentence: 驗定眾心。
translation: He examines the minds of the crowd.

source_sentence: 受籌者多，不受者少，以少從多，開門助惡成禍，內與外應，欲令敵勝。
translation: Those who accept the chips are numerous, those who don't accept them are few, and because of the few and following the many, they open their doors to help evil and create misfortune, and they respond internally and externally in order to make their opponents victorious.

source_sentence: 勸善者少，得開門入，入挌殺門衛五百人，斬害不訾，生縛貴姓三萬人，
translation: Those who are encouraged to do good deeds are few, and they can open the gates and enter. Entering a dispute, they kill five hundred guards of the gates, behead non-monks, and bind 30,000 people of noble families.

source_sentence: 埋著于地，但令頭現，驅迫群象，比足蹈殺，然後駕犁而耕其首，值此酷者，
translation: He buried it on the ground and caused its head to appear, chased the elephants away, trampled them at their feet, and killed them. Then he drove a plow to plow their heads and they were tortured by this cruel animal.

source_sentence: 皆須陀洹。
translation: They're all stream-winners.

source_sentence: 釋摩男者，波斯匿之舊好也，自謂國人：「諦觀無常，苦毒之對，宿罪當償，
translation: Śākyamuni, the old friend of Prasenajit, said to the people of his country, “Look closely at impermanence and confront it with suffering and poison.

source_sentence: 勿懷怨恨，生現尋死，存者忽終，若干之痛斧解五杌。」
translation: Don't harbor grudges, and if someone dies in the present life or suddenly dies while alive, they'll be cured by a painful axe that removes five abscesses.

source_sentence: 喟然悲歎：「食福同時，而受禍一處。」
translation: They suddenly grieved and lamented, Eating goodness at the same time brings harm in one place.

source_sentence: 豪族七萬餘生，復見生獲，鐵鎖其頸。
translation: More than seventy thousand living beings of the powerful clan were reborn, and they were once again captured by the enemy with an iron chain around their necks.

source_sentence: 貴姓女千人，以鎖貫之，羅竪道側。
translation: A thousand women of noble families were chained to him, and he was beside the road at Rāvana.

source_sentence: 貴姓年少嬰兒，置于格上，而射殺之。
translation: A young child of noble family was placed in the monastery and shot and killed him.

source_sentence: 時琉璃王，見釋摩男與眾辛苦，顧謂臣曰：「是何人乎？」
translation: When the king of the lapis lazuli, seeing that Śākyamuni and the others were suffering, he looked around his ministers and said, Who is this person?

source_sentence: 答曰：「釋摩男。
translation: He answered, Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 釋摩男之來，欲有所乞。」
translation: When Śākyamuni came, he wanted to ask for something.

source_sentence: 王曰：「現之。」
translation: The king said, Show it to him.

source_sentence: 釋自陳曰：「王之大王！
translation: Śākyamuni said to himself, Great king of kings!

source_sentence: 存遇隆厚，聽納所啟，當具以聞。」
translation: I'm grateful to you for the generosity of your presence, and I'll listen to what you tell me.

source_sentence: 王識委曲，恣其所說。
translation: The king's consciousness was entrusted to him, and he did as he said.

source_sentence: 「願節威怒，唯權止兵，無令放逸，多所殘害。
translation: The Vātsīputrīya's authority and anger are limited to the right to stopping troops, not causing them to be careless and often inflicting harm.

source_sentence: 我入池中，斯須當還，與王密議立見策也，待我出水，乃復燿旅。」
translation: I'll enter the pond, and you must return if you want to make a secret discussion with the king about establishing views and strategies, so wait until I get out of the water before you leave again.

source_sentence: 王心與口言：「人在水中，勢不得久。」
translation: The king's mind and mouth said, They're in the water, and their momentum won't last long.

source_sentence: 即聽所白。
translation: He then listens to what's said.

source_sentence: 於是摩男，為國人民遭大厄故，辭行入池，解髮繫樹，自沈于水，良久不還。
translation: Māṇḍavyūha then went into a pond for the sake of the people of his kingdom, who were in great danger. He dismounted from his excursion and climbed up a tree that was attached to him; but he remained submerged in the water for a long time without returning.

source_sentence: 王大怪焉，遂遣左右，往求料索，於樹根下，得其尸喪，出殯池側。
translation: The king was greatly surprised, so he sent his men to search for the treasure. At the foot of a tree they found their dead bodies buried by the side of a burial pond.

source_sentence: 王甚憐之，有慈哀心：「用門族故，自沈而死，其義若茲。
translation: The king felt great pity for him and had a compassionate feeling of sympathy, saying, “Because of the actions of his clansmen he sank down on his own and died.

source_sentence: 吾為國主，不忍小忿，豈當急戰，使所害彌熾乎？」
translation: As the lord of my country, I can't tolerate minor anger; how could I have to fight so quickly that the harm would become even more intense?

source_sentence: 前三億人畢對併命；
translation: The first three hundred million died at the same time.

source_sentence: 次三億人蒙自次之，救得皆視息，奔突走脫，得全濟命；
translation: The next three hundred million people were reprimanded accordingly, and when they came to the rescue they all checked their breaths.

source_sentence: 又三億人，修家供養，歡宴熙怡，伎樂自娛，不知外有併命之厄，亦不聞有奔波之怖，
translation: Three hundred million people attended the monastery to make offerings, and they were delighted. They played music and enjoyed themselves in amusement. They did not know that there would be troubles outside of the country but neither did they hear that there would be fear of running and wading.

source_sentence: 安雅如常，一無所豫。
translation: The peace and comfort are as usual, but there's nothing to expect.

source_sentence: 琉璃王厚葬摩男，存寵其後，王平舍夷更立長，安慰畢訖，還舍衛國。
translation: The lapis lazuli king had a generous burial for the prince Māṇḍavyūha and bestowed favors on him. After reconciling Śākyamuni, the king reappointed Chang as his elder and returned to Sāvatthī after comforting him.

source_sentence: 佛與弟子至迦維羅衛，見諸人民傷殘者多，又察眾女人，杌無手足耳鼻支體，
translation: When the Buddha and his disciples arrived in Kapilavastu, they saw that many of the people were wounded. They also observed that the women had no hands, feet, ears, nose, or limbs [to sustain them].

source_sentence: 身形裸露，委在坑塹，無用自蔽，世間苦痛如是，不仁之人，相害甚酷。
translation: Their bodies are naked and exposed, entrusted to a pit or ditch where there is no need to shield oneself. Such is the pain and suffering of the world in this way.

source_sentence: 佛言諸比丘：「彼琉璃王，肆意惡逆，罪盛乃爾，却數七日，有地獄火，
translation: The Buddha said to the monks: That king of lapis lazuli, who was so intent on inflicting harmful and heinous sins that for seven days there was a blazing fire in hell.

source_sentence: 當燒殺之，現世作罪，便現世受。」
translation: You'll burn and kill them, commit a sin in the present life, and then receive it in the present life.

source_sentence: 大史奏讖，怪與佛同，王大恐怖，乘船入海，冀得自免，停住海中。
translation: The king was greatly fearful and boarded the ship to sail into the sea. Hoping to escape, he remained in the middle of the sea.

source_sentence: 至于七日期盡，水中則有自然火出，燒船及王，一時灰滅。
translation: On the seventh day, a spontaneous fire emerges from the water and burns the boat and the king in flames. All at once the ashes are extinguished.

source_sentence: 世尊哀愍諸裸露者，即以威神動忉利天紫紺之殿，帝釋及后、首耶之等，
translation: The World-honored One had compassion for the naked ones, and with his mighty power he moved the purple and violet halls of the Trāyastriṃśa gods, Indra, the queen, Śubhavyūha, etc.

source_sentence: 無數天子各齎天衣，俱供來下，以服覆遍裸露厄者。
translation: Countless celestial beings each brought heavenly robes to offer to the gods, covering them with their robes and exposing those in distress.

source_sentence: 「諸仁目所見，　　現在變如是，
translation: “Friends, what you see is like this in the present.

source_sentence: 畢故莫造新，　　後可長度脫。」
translation: Don't build anything new after it's finished, and you'll be liberated for a long time to come.

source_sentence: 佛為眾女而說偈曰：佛歎偈已，復為說法。
translation: The Buddha spoke a verse for the women, saying, After praising them in verse, the Buddha again explained the teaching.

source_sentence: 諸來觀者，天、龍、鬼神、阿須倫、迦留羅、真陀羅、摩休勒、梵志、居士、長者、人民，
translation: The gods, dragons, ghosts, asuras, garuḍas, mahoragas, Brahmās, brahmins, householders, wealthy men, and the people came to see.

source_sentence: 無央數千聞佛所說，五百比丘漏盡意解；
translation: Countless thousands of those who heard the Buddha’s exhortation had their minds and intellects liberated by listening to what five hundred bhikṣus taught.

source_sentence: 五百梵志、其餘現人，見國荒毀傷殘之痛，出家遵道，皆為沙門；
translation: Five hundred brahmins and the rest of the common people saw their country deserted and injured, leaving home to follow the Buddhist path. All of them became śramaṇas.

source_sentence: 五百天子，立不起法忍；
translation: Five hundred celestial beings established the forbearance of not rising above the Teaching.

source_sentence: 二百阿須倫、千龍王，皆發無上正真道意；
translation: Two hundred asuras and one thousand dragon kings all aroused the aspiration for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 溝坑五杌裸形男女，命盡得上生忉利天；
translation: A naked man and a woman with five calves in a ditch or pit can be reborn up to the Trāyastriṃśa gods when their life ends.

source_sentence: 千五百人得見道迹；
translation: One thousand five hundred people were able to see the traces of the Way.

source_sentence: 千人得不還證。
translation: A thousand people attained it and didn't return to realize it.

source_sentence: 佛說此已，一切遍聞，稽首而退。
translation: After the Buddha had explained this, they all heard it, bowed their heads and withdrew.

source_sentence: 佛說琉璃王經
translation: Foshuo lapis lazuli king jing
